Alerts.AppUpdateDone:
Downloading new app version {{version}} has finished successfully. 
The app will now restart, in order for the new version to be applied.
Alerts.WikiUpdateDone: Downloading new wiki files for version {{version}} has finished succesfully.
Alerts.CannotUpdate:
Pocket Dota is trying to update its Wiki to a version higher than {{version}}, but has encountered an error. 
There might be a problem with your connection; please restart the app and make sure you're connected to the internet. 

THIS UPDATE IS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - if the update is not made, the application might not show the data correctly; this might lead to a crash due to lack of correct data.
Alerts.UpdateCheckAvailable:
A new {{What}} version has been found. ({{newVersion}}) 
Would you like to begin downloading it? 
It is recomended to be connected to a WI-FI network before downloading new data.
Alerts.RemoveProfileData_Title: Are you sure you want to remove your profile data?
Alerts.RemoveProfileData: This will remove the Dota 2 profile data store on this device.
Alerts.ResetSettingsTitle: Are you sure you want to reset settings to default?
Alerts.ResetSettings: This will reset the settings to default, including the removal of the Dota 2 profile data.

AppDownloading.downloading_done: When the update is done, the application will restart.

WikiDownloading.CONSENT_PRECACHE_IMAGES:
Would you like to pre-cache the images for heroes and items?
This will ensure that you get the best experience while using Pocket Dota, by not having to wait for the images to load later on.

DOWNLOAD_REASONS.FRESH: Because this is the first time you open the app, additional files need to be downloaded (eg: hero/ item descriptions, images).
DOWNLOAD_REASONS.MISSING: Some wiki data on your device seems to be missing. Please wait while the app re-downloads the data.
DOWNLOAD_REASONS.UPDATE: Downloading new wiki database (heroes, items and game info).
DOWNLOAD_REASONS.FORCED:
Downloading new wiki database (heroes, items and game info). 
The new database is needed for the new app version.

Components.RequiresConnection_OfflineText:
There seems to be a problem with your internet connection. 
This section is only available when connected to the internet. 

You may still hide this message and display the content, but navigating through this section would lead to nowhere.
Components.Updater_persistingProblem: If the problem persists, please clear the application files.

Screen_About.WikiData_description: refers to all of the information displayed about the Dota 2 heroes, items and patch notes throughout the app.
Screen_About.PlayerStatistics_description: refers to all of the information displayed within the Player statistics screens.
Screen_About.FreeApp: is a free app that aims to give players an insight from within the game, when they're unable to access the actual game. It can also be used while playing the game, in order to keep track of the heroes and items of the opposing teams.
Screen_About.NotEndorsed: is hereby not created, sponsored or endorsed by any of the companies mentioned on this page. It only uses open source data.
Screen_About.Copyright_TheGame: The Dota 2 game, logo, the contents of game files (heroes, abilities, items, patch notes, tips), as well as their artwork/ names/ descriptions are Â© {{valve_corporation}}.
Screen_About.Copyright_GameFiles: Dota2 game files and images provided by {{elo}}, through {{dota_buff}} and parsed by Pocket Dota's own data generator service.
Screen_About.Copyright_OpenDotaData: The data presented through the Player statistics screen are information collected, parsed, displayed and owned by {{open_dota}}.
Screen_About.Copyright_OpenDotaShoutout: For an even more in-depth analysis of your player profile, it is recommended to open their website on a desktop/ laptop computer and create an Open Dota account.
Screen_About.Tech_TheWiki: The Wiki data is automatically generated from the Dota 2 game files, and updated when the information in these changes, through a {{nodejs}} backend service.
Screen_About.Tech_Frameworks: The application is developed in {{react_native}}, having {{expo}} as a React Native management utility.
Screen_About.Contact_Issues: If you experience any issues with the usage of this app, please use the {{issues}} channel.
Screen_About.Contact_Features: If you would like to see more functionality brought into the app, use the {{feature_requests}} channel.
Screen_About.Contact_General: If you just wanna have a chat with the app's developer, use the {{general}} channel.

Screen_Settings.Profile_EnableThirdParty: In order to enable the functions below, you have to add a Dota 2 profile

Screen_SettingsAppTips.IOS_slideBack_description: You can swipe from the left side of the screen to go to back.
Screen_SettingsAppTips.drawerSlide_description: You can swipe from the right side of the screen to open the drawer.
Screen_SettingsAppTips.attributesSlider_description: You can use the slider below the hero image to see how the attributes change at different hero levels.
Screen_SettingsAppTips.profileAddRequirements_description: In order for your Dota 2 profile to be parsed by Valve, you need to check the in-game setting of "Expose Public Match Data" (settings/options/advanced options).
Screen_SettingsAppTips.profileAdd_description:
You can add a Dota 2 profile to the app's Home screen by clicking the profile icon at the top of this screen. 
This way, you can quickly acces your Dota 2 stats when opening the app.
Screen_SettingsAppTips.profileAdded_description: This Dota 2 profile has been added to the app. The profile will be available on the app's Home screen, unless this option is disabled under "Settings".

Screen_SettingsLanguage.UPDATE: The language files are out of date. Would you like to update them?
Screen_SettingsLanguage.DOWNLOAD_ASK: In order to use the selected language, aditional files need to be downloaded. Would you like to continue

Screen_Stats.TypeProfileName: Type in profile name to look up
Screen_Stats.CouldNotFind: Could not find any results for

Screen_StatsWeb.CONTENT:
The Dota 2 player profiles are a collection of statistics gathered and parsed by the {{open_dota}} platform 
These statistics show an in-depth analysis of the player's activity in the Dota 2 game. 
Because the statistics screen is a preview of the Open Dota website, you will need the following buttons in order to navigate the Dota 2 player profiles:
Screen_StatsWeb.BUTTON_BACK: Use the BACK button to navigate back in the current (statistics) screen.
Screen_StatsWeb.BUTTON_FORWARD: Use the FORWARD button to navigate back in the current (statistics) screen.
Screen_StatsWeb.BUTTON_USER: When the PROFILE button is pressed, it will be highlighted, indicating that the current Dota 2 profile is the one that will appear on the app's home screen.
Screen_StatsWeb.DOTA_PROFILE: To set another player profile, simply navigate to another Dota 2 profile (from the Stats screen) and press the PROFILE button.
